comment.text: Thiol protease which is believed to participate in intracellular degradation and turnover of proteins. Has also been implicated in tumor invasion and metastasis.

Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds. Preferentially cleaves -Arg-Arg-|-Xaa bonds in small molecule substrates (thus differing from cathepsin L). In addition to being an endopeptidase, shows peptidyl-dipeptidase activity, liberating C-terminal dipeptides.
Dimer of a heavy chain and a light chain cross-linked by a disulfide bond. Interacts with SRPX2. Directly interacts with SHKBP1 (PubMed:16733801).
Identified by mass spectrometry in melanosome fractions from stage I to stage IV.
Belongs to the peptidase C1 family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology
